name: nvram-wifi-interface-access
description: The HTTP server accesses wireless interface configuration variables (wl%d_ifname) via bcm_nvram_get. These variables store wireless interface names and may be used to construct system commands. No apparent input validation or filtering was detected.
notes: The variable format is wl%d_ifname, where %d may be controlled by external input, requiring further validation of the input source.

name: nvram-check-button-access
description: The HTTP server accesses the 'check_button_result' variable via bcm_nvram_get and copies it to the destination buffer using the insecure strcpy function. The lack of boundary checking may lead to a buffer overflow vulnerability.
notes: Using the insecure strcpy function to copy NVRAM variable values may be exploited for buffer overflow attacks.

name: nvram-check-button-access
description: The HTTP server accesses the 'check_all_button' variable via bcm_nvram_get to check the button status. This access appears to be secure and is not directly used for hazardous operations.
